meanings.definition: A play in baseball in which a runner is put out because the defensive team forces them to leave the base they are on.
meanings.sent1: The forceout at second base ended the inning for the team.
meanings.sent2: The umpire called a forceout when the runner couldn't reach the next base.
meanings.sent3: The forceout at first base was so quick, it seemed like a magic trick.
meanings.sent4: In the game, every forceout felt like a strategic chess move.
meanings.sent5: The forceout was like a sudden stop sign for the runner, halting their progress abruptly.

meanings.definition: The act of forcing a runner out in baseball.
meanings.sent1: The coach praised the player for executing a perfect forceout.
meanings.sent2: The forceout was crucial in preventing the opposing team from scoring.
meanings.sent3: During practice, the forceout drill always brought out the competitive spirit in the players.
meanings.sent4: The forceout was like a well-timed interception in football, stealing the opportunity from the runner.
meanings.sent5: The forceout was a swift and decisive move, catching the runner off guard.
